div.p: See upcoming events for athletics, clubs, special meetings, and more.
See what our students will be having for Breakfast and Lunch.
Stay up-to-date by reading the daily announcements.

div.h4: Some of our Junior High and High School band students travelled to Ellington on March 9th to participate in the BRL Band performance.

span.style: color: #1c1e21; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

h4.span: Several juniors and seniors traveled to the 42nd annual high school art exhibition at the CRISP museum at SEMO. This year, 550 pieces of art were submitted by juniors and seniors from 37 different schools. Out of the 550 entries, only 110 pieces were selected to be displayed at the museum. Charleigh Lancaster had her charcoal drawing of a cat chosen to be displayed this year. Great job, Charleigh!

span.style: color: #1c1e21; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

h4.span: Holden Laughman scored his 1,500th career point in the final game of the season. This is an amazing accomplishment and we are proud of you. Great job Holden!!!!

div.h4: We had four seniors reach 1,000 point milestones during their playing careers. We are proud of you all and what you have been able to achieve.

div.h1: LESTERVILLE VOLLEYBALL'S REESE GRAY NAMED TO TOP 59 FRESHMEN VARSITY PLAYERS IN NATION

div.h4: Freshmen Reese Gray of Lesterville has been named to the 2019 Frosh 59 by PrepVolleyball. This an honor given to only 59 varsity freshmen nation-wide. Reese helped the Lady Bearcats win their 4th straight District Championship, as well as advancing to the state quarterfinal game. Gray finished her remarkable season with 321 kills, 401 digs, 508 receptions, and 37 aces. She was also an All-Conference, All-District, and Class 1 All-State pick. Reese is a dynamic player. A hard hitter who also has defensive grit and never gives up on a ball. Congratulations, Reese!!
